Complexe Nesting Case



You can even run it.

          
mixin = {
  foo: (m="default", p={x:10,y:20}, t=(1.2 * 455) / 7) -> /default/.exec m
  get: (id=(if b? then 'defaultA' else 'defaultB'), b=true) -> @member[id]
  meta: class Meta
    @description: """This is a string on
       multiple lines (#{
        class Foo
          get: (o) -> if /^[abc]/g.test o then "#{o}t" else o

        new Foo().get 'bar'
      }) and even a multiple line interpolation.
      """
  prop: 10
}




        

        

          
Native

          
require 'foo'
module.exports = {}
exports.foo = ->
console.log 'foo'
print bar



        

        

          
Assignment

          
number = 42
opposite &&= true
exists ?= {}
[a,b] = o
{a,b:c} = o
{@a,@b} = o
[a,b,c] = (parseInt s for s in o)
o =
  bar: foo,
  foo: bar
o = {a, b, c: 10}
o = {
  a,
  b,
  c: isNaN parseFloat 10
}



        

        

          
Constants



To match ruby conventions, words in upper case
will be marked as constant.

          
CONSTANT = 302
I18n = 112
NATIVES = [ Date, String, Array, JSON, RegExp ]

d = new Date ()
d.setDate()



        

        

          
Conditions

          
number = -42 unless opposite is 'foo' and typeof bar isnt 'function'

Prototype

          
@::__super__.defRGB

Interpolation

          
single = 'This is \' not an #{interpolation}'
single = 'This is a string on
 multiple lines'
double = "And the \" number is #{ number * 20 * parseFloat @multiplier }"
double = "And the \" number is #{ foo "bar #{ 10 }" }"
double = "And the \" number is #{ foo {a, b: 10} }"
double = "And the \" number is #{ foo {a, b: "foo #{ {c: 10} }"} }"



        

        

          
Heredocs

          
heredocs_double = """with interpolation #{14 * foo.bar()}"""
heredocs_double = """
Hello "world" and 'world' and #{ number / @divider }
"""

heredocs_single = '''without #{interpolation}'''
heredocs_single = '''
Hello 'world' and "world" and not an #{interpolation}
'''

race = ( winners, runners... ) ->
  print winner, runners

Loops

Class

          
class A extends Module
class B extends A
class Animal
  @static: foo
  property:10

  constructor: (@name = "hello") -> @bar = "foo"

  move: (meters) ->
    alert "#{ @name } moved #{ meters }m."

bud = new Animal

f /foo


        

        

          
          
f / foo / gm


        

        

          
          
f /foo * 2/6



        

        

          
Regexps

          
f /6 * 2/gm


        

        

          
          
f /foo * 2/gm


        

        

          
          
re = /^.*mymatch[\s]+(foo){1,5}\n$/gmi


        

        

          
          
re =  /[,?;.:/!§*%=\[\](){}'"`\\_<>-^]/g


        

        

          
          
args = [/^default$/, 'js']


        

        

          
          
args = [/^default$/]


        

        

          
          
args = {re: /^default$/}


        

        

          
          
args = foo(/^\/[/]$/)


        

        

          
          
args = /default/.exec



        

        

          
Heregex

          
re = ///foo#{@bar}///


        

        

          
          
re = /// ^ (
  #{ @interpolated coffee }
  ?: [-=]>             # function
   | [-+*/%<>&|^!?=]=  # compound assign / compare
   | >>>=?             # zero-fill right shift
   | ([^-+:])\1        # doubles
   | ([&|<>])\2=?      # logic / shift
   | \?\.              # soak access
   | \.{2,3}           # range or splat
   (?=adf)             # TODO foo
   \.foo               # FIXME foo
   (?!n)
) ///gi

Deep title

Some code code in a comment



    

  1. Ordered list item 1
    2. 

  2. Ordered list item 2
    3. 

  3. Ordered list item 3
    4. 

  4. Unordered list item
    5. 

  5. Unordered list item
    6. 

  6. Unordered list item
    7. 




But 1., *, + or - shouldn't be colored
when not preceded by two spaces.



italic
bold



Some code in the comments



# With comments
class Foo
  constructor: ->
    @bar = 10
    @foo = @bar * 1354
    @string = "kdsmflk"
